profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:11-0400

did.physdesc: 44 sound tape reels (22 hr., 18 min.) : analog, 3 3/4 & 7 1/2 ips, half track & full track, mono : 5 in., 7 in.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material has access restritions. Please consult a curator for details.

did.unittitle: Songs relating to the Iroqouis Midwinter Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of songs and speeches selected from "Songs from the Iroquois longhouse," ed. William N. Fenton (Washington, D.C.: Library of Congress, 1942) interspersed with English translations and explanations by William N. Fenton.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

did.unittitle: Dictation for proof reading against original of "The Journal of James Emlen, Kept on a Trip to Canandaigua, New York, September 15 - October 30, 1794, to Attend A Treaty Between the United States and the Six Nations" [1 of 2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: William F. Fenton dictating for proof reading against William N. Fenton, editor, "The Journal of James Emlen, Kept on a Trip to Canandaigua, New York, September 15 - October 30, 1794, to Attend A Treaty Between the United States and the Six Nations." (_Ethnohistory_ 12(4): 279-342, 1965)

did.unittitle: Dark Dance, Sour Springs Cayuga [1 of 2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Program was originally recorded on phonograph discs, and later transfer to reel-to-reels. This recording was copied in 1955 from original reels at the Library of Congress.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Phonograph record) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

did.unittitle: Dark Dance, a medicine society, at Coldspring [1 of 3]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Opening speech is described on the original tape box as a tobacco invocation to the Little People. This recording contains significant periods of inaudible or minimally audible conversation. Opening invocation spans from :10 - 4:00. Music starts at 9:35 - 20:08, and again at 21:10 - 24:13.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "This canto announces the arrival of the Little People who come from 10 nights away from the rocky places, through meadows, over swamps and streams." Program concludes with an account by the researcher in English of the origin of the Dark Dance.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Performance of the Seneca Corn Dance, followed by a discussion of its history and current use.

did.unittitle: Coldspring Longhouse Midwinter Festival: On the Husk Faces and their appearance on VIth night

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A report given by the researcher regarding events seen at and surrounding the Seneca Coldspring Longhouse Midwinter Festival. Original recording contains a several minutes of silence. At time marker 3:45, three seconds of silence been inserted to represent 3:20 of silent tape that has been deleted. This is followed by 2:48 of tape with faintly audible speech. Fully audible speech recommences at time marker 6:36.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A report given by the researcher regarding the history and use of the Wa?eno?e:? dance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A performance of the Wenothowi'sas Women's Rite, followed by a report by the researcher on its content and origin story. There is a 6-second silent gap on the original recording, beginning at 19:09, which has been retained.
